Name: Curly head
Description: This fragment of fabric is composed of linen decorated with bouclé linen and bouclé wool in red, brown, green and ochre. A lightly smiling face, surmounted by a hairstyle gathered up in a chignon occupies this very damaged cloth. The shoulders are covered by a multicoloured tunic. The piece, which probably came from Hermopolis, probably dates from the 6th century.
